content.description: Reachy crux right off the ground. There are good hold all the way to the top but they require a little searching. Fun route that is easier than it looks.
content.location: Just right of Bayou Boy. Vertigo is the second bolted line from the left side of the Hemlock Block.

content.description:
Climb the steep tiers on mostly good holds, with a few decent rests.  

  Give thanks for all that is steep and juggy.
content.location: Right side of Hemlock Block. Belay from standing ledge.

content.description: Scramble up onto the Hemlock boulder. Stick clip. Climb pumpy jugs straight up to the anchor under the roof for the 10d or continue to high anchors for the 11d version (Swamp Monster).
content.location: Second route from the right on Hemlock Block proper. Just left of Tabernacle (12a).

content.description: Reach first moves to get off the ground, then work your way up arete to anchors
content.location: The rightmost route of the three that are around on the back side of the hemlock block

content.description: Start in a stemming corner to a good rest under an imposing roof. Climb steep jugs through a near-horizontal roof and mantle onto a no-hands rest ledge. Traverse left either campusing or using deft footwork to get established on the face. Climb perfect rock to a stopper move involving either a dynamic toss or a reachy lock-off. Finish on the exposed arete. Tall and classic!
Shares hard startÂ with swamp cookie then heads left.

climbs.name: Bayou Boy
climbs.fa: Micah Gentry and Elden Earhart fall 2011

content.description: A great practice route for Deep Creeks classic routes. A slightly reachy crux past the first bolt leads to chill climbing before you tackle the imposing roof, but don't worry there are jugs and great footholds all the way to the anchors.
content.location: This route is the left most line on the hemlock block. It is the last line before you head to the Shadow wall and Little Hemlock Wall.

content.description: Start on ledge, go up chimney/corner then hand traverse left and up onto ledge under roof. Get horizontal and pull out onto arete. A couple fun moves up to jugs to top.
content.location: At top of approach trail. 15 feet left of Down Not Out
